{{Infobox Dotcom company | company_name = Compete.com | company_logo = [[Image:Compete.com logo.png|250px]] | company_type = Subsidiary | genre = Web Analytics/Market Research | foundation = 2000 | founder = Bill Gross | location_city = Boston, Massachusetts | location_country = United States | location = | locations = | area_served = U.S. Internet Users | key_people = | industry = Online Competitive Intelligence | products = MyCompete (free), Compete Pro Standard, Compete Pro Advanced, Compete Pro Enterprise | services = Site Profile, Search Analytics, Referral Analytics, Ranked Lists, Category Profile, Compete Blog | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | assets = | equity = | owner = [[Kantar Group]] ([[WPP Group|WPP]]) | num_employees = | parent = | divisions = | subsid = | slogan =
| alexa = {{decrease}} 901 ({{as of|2011|12|2|alt=December 2011}})<ref name="alexa">{{cite web|url= http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/Compete.com |title= Compete.com Site Info | publisher= [[Alexa Internet]] |accessdate= 2011-12-02 }}</ref><!--Updated monthly by OKBot.--> | url = http://compete.com/ | url = http://www.compete.com | intl = | website_type = [[web traffic]] and [[web ranking|ranking]] | language = English | current_status = active }} '''Compete.com''' is a [[web traffic]] analysis service of Compete, Inc. which operates in the [[United States]] and publishes the approximate number of global visitors to the top 1,000,000 web sites in the world. This number is computed from sources including [[internet service providers]], opt-in panels, application providers, and users of the Compete toolbar.
==Services== Compete.com provides two categories of information: *'''Site Analytics,''' a free service, where the user can enter up to five domain names and receive Traffic Volume for the entered Websites. *'''Search Analytics,''' a paid service that shows the user which keywords are sending traffic to the user's website and its competitors.<ref>[http://web.analyticsblog.ca/2010/03/web-page-rank-from-google-alexa-quantcast-and-compete-com/ McGill University CMIS 530 Web Analytics Blog] Web Analytics blog</ref>
==Company history== Compete.com is a service of [http://www.competeinc.com Compete, Inc.], which was launched in 2000 by [[Bill Gross (entrepreneur)|Bill Gross]], an entrepreneur who started the search engine GoTo.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.compete.com/help |title=Compete: FAQ |accessdate=2008-04-19}}</ref> In March 2008, London market research company [[Taylor Nelson Sofres|TNS]] purchased [http://www.competeinc.com Compete, Inc.] for $150 million.<ref>http://www.xconomy.com/boston/2008/08/21/tripadvisor-takes-flipkey-majority-stake/</ref>
Compete.com has more than 2 million members as of 2008.<ref>[http://www.readwriteweb.com/archives/compete_takes_on_alexa.php Compete Takes On Alexa - Launches SnapShot and Social Search - ReadWriteWeb<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
